page.title: 17Changing Times
page.content: In 1966 the Tay Road Bridge from Dundee to Fife with immediate access to the Newport area opened resulting in considerable change to the area, most strikingly in the amount of new housing built. Previouslu most of the housing was Victorian and owned by business men who used the ferry or train but now there is a large amount of modern housing for an increasingly expanding population due to the bridge. The two schools in the area have been rebuilt on what were fields and are now modern open plan buildings. 25 years ago the whole area was quieter with many more open spaces. There used to be a cinema which has now been converted to a youth club and the shopping faciities have changed to suit the populations requirements.
